alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Blount; Cocke; Grainger; Greene; Hamblen; Hawkins; Jefferson; Knox; Sevier; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 26 at 1:19AM CDT until June 26 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Hawkins County in east Tennessee... Knox County in east Tennessee... Central Anderson County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Blount County in east Tennessee... Jefferson County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Cocke County in east Tennessee... West central Greene County in east Tennessee... Central Grainger County in east Tennessee... Southeastern Union County in east Tennessee... Northern Sevier County in east Tennessee... Hamblen County in east Tennessee... * Until 300 AM EDT. * At 218 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Bean Station to near Plainview to near Knoxville to near Oak Ridge, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Morristown, Sevierville, Alcoa, Jefferson City, Dandridge, Rutledge, Pigeon Forge, Bean Station and White Pine. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 381 and 431. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 108 and 113. Interstate 81 in Tennessee between mile markers 1 and 27. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Anderson; Blount; Cocke; Grainger; Greene; Hamblen; Hawkins; Jefferson; Knox; Sevier; Union
